newsitem.title: ISRAEL: SOCCER-PALESTINIAN POLICE KILL MAN IN MATCH RIOT - WITNESS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PALESTINIAN POLICE KILL MAN IN MATCH RIOT - WITNESS.

text.p: NABLUS, West Bank, Sept 23 (Reuter ) - Palestinian police opened fire on rioting fans during a soccer match in PLO-ruled Nablus on Monday killing one man and seriously wounding two others, eyewitnesses said.

Palestinian officials said a committee of inquiry was formed and that the police officers involved were to be detained. They said President Yasser Arafat had cancelled all soccer games pending the committee's findings.
Eyewitnesses said the shooting took place during a match between a Tulkarm team and one from East Jerusalem.

"The referee called a goal for the Jerusalem team and the players from the Tulkarm team got angry and started hitting him," said Hani Sulwein, 63, one of the fans who was shot and wounded. Sulwein had the bullet removed and was in serious but stable condition.
"At the same time fans of the Tulkarm team started throwing stones and empty bottles at the referee and his assistants. It was then that the police opened fire and I was hit in the stomach."
Nablus Governor Mahmoud Aloul said such incidents had happened throughout the world.
"We have formed an inquiry committee to look into what caused the incident. Soccer games have been cancelled until further notice on the order of President Arafat," Aloul said in a statement.
